entry.title: Middle Helladic Argolid Project Publications Online
entry.content:
Shifting Identities: Social Change and Cultural Interaction in the Middle Helladic Argolid, 2000 - 1500 BC
This international, multidisciplinary project has received a Grant for Innovative Research by the Netherlands Organisation for Scientific Research (NWO). The project is also financed by the University of Groningen.

The aim of the project is to interpret the important social, political and cultural changes that took place in the southern Greek mainland during the Middle Helladic period and the transition to the Late Helladic (approx. 2000 - 1500 BC). The task is undertaken by means of an integrated analysis of settlement, funerary, skeletal and iconographic data from the Argolid, northeastern Peloponnese.

The central question of the project, the redefinition of personal, ethnic and cultural identities within wider processes of socio-political change, has a wider relevance beyond the Aegean and occupies a central position in current theoretical debates in archaeology.


Scanned-in articles
Here we include:
  • Articles on the MH period published by members of the team, and by scholars collaborating with the project. We also include unpublished work (e.g. unpublished dissertations) as well as forthcoming articles which have not appeared as yet.
  • Articles that have appeared in the periodical Hydra (published by Gullög Nordquist and Carol Zerner between 1985 and 1994).
The articles are listed below in alphabetical order.
Please note: this part of the site is still under construction, and articles are continuously being added to.
To read these articles you need Adobe Acrobat Reader.
It can be downloaded for free here
